articles.description: A new study also finds that 71 percent of critically ill coronavirus patients under 50 were obese.
articles.content:
The high mortality rate, especially among elderly patients with some underlying disease, stunned Max ODonnell, the senior author of the study and a pulmonologist at Columbia University Irving Medical Center.

articles.title: What is Kawasaki disease? How to recognize the symptoms in your child - Insider - INSIDER
articles.description: Kawasaki disease is most likely to affect children under five years old and of Asian heritage. Here's how to recognize the symptoms.
articles.content:
Kawasaki disease, also known as mucocutaneous lymph node syndrome, is an inflammation of the blood vessels that is most common in children. About 75% of Kawasaki disease cases occur in kids younger than five years old. 
Overall, the disease is very rare, aff… [+6889 chars]
